p: DWV appears to be the most prevalent honey bee pathogen, occurring in approximately 55% of colonies worldwide [ 58]. We found high DWV prevalence in honey bees but also in Argentine ants. The list of DWV hosts is long [ 58]. We add to it by reporting the first DWV case in the order Orthoptera ( Bobilla) and in New Zealand native Hymenoptera ( Xanthocryptus novozealandicus and Sphictostethus nitidus), Coleoptera ( Scolopterus penicillatus), and Blattodea ( Maoriblatta).
